summary: Imagine taking down a villain all on your own
body:
Imagine taking down a villain all on your own

Summary: The heroes leave Y/N alone at the Tower when they get a lead on a dangerous villain, but what they don’t know is said villain was hiding out in the Tower. Now he is with Y/N and will do whatever it takes to end her life and get what he needs. What he doesn’t know is Y/N isn’t going to let that happen.

Pairing(s): Tony Stark x Stark!Reader, Peter Parker x Reader

“Are you sure you have to go?” Y/N asked wantonly, her arms hung lazily over his shoulders. He chuckled fondly, turning on the spot to place his hands carefully at her waist. He was wearing half his suit, keeping his mask off for the time being until the team would leave for the mission they were initially called to after a lead on a powerful villain arose, giving them a chance to hit him head on and stop his ways. “I’m sure Dad and the others will be just fine.”

“Has to be the whole team. I really want Mr. Stark to know I’m committed to the team as much as I can be.” Peter insisted, before leaning forward to peck her lips. “I’ll be back right after and we can watch a movie or something, okay?” Y/N pouted, but nodded anyway. She knew it was wrong for her to pull him from something he loved. He definitely loved the Avengers to the moon and back. It was his dream to be a part of them.

“You gonna be okay, baby girl?” Tony’s voice interrupted her train of thought, making her turn to face her father, who was covered by his suit but left his head free. “I left my card on the counter if you want something to eat. We’ll be back as soon as we can.” Smiling, he kissed her forehead before waving towards the others. “Let’s go!”

Each of the heroes made way to follow their unofficial leader, bidding Y/N goodbyes with either side hugs, kisses, or a high-five in Scott’s case. Soon enough, it was dead silent on the floor, leaving her all alone while her family would go to save the world. It became a pattern of being alone and being surrounded by so many people who she loved so much. Y/N got used to it, although it didn’t stop the small bouts of panic she carried that one of them would get hurt. It always seemed to be either her father or Peter catching the wrong end of that stick.

“Guess it’s marathon time,” Y/N mumbled to herself shuffling her way to the large living area equipped for everyone, as well as an armchair for Thor since he tended to fling his arms around whenever he got excited at what was on; that resulted in countless bruises for an unfortunate Steve, who always somehow got to sit next to him.

Sitting down at her usual spot, she retrieved the remote and switched it on, already trailing through channels as she hummed quietly to herself.

Then she suddenly stopped.

Her eyebrows fiddling together in order to give her a distinctly confused expression, she muted the screen and got up to her knees, turning on the spot to look over the couch. She was sure she heard footsteps. They were far too heavy to be mistaken as an animal. But now it was too quiet to tell if she was assuming things or not.

As cliché as it was, she couldn’t help but call out, “Hello?”

Silence.

Deciding her mind was playing tricks on her, Y/N gave herself a little shake before she returned to her previous position, grabbing at the remote.

BANG!

Y/N finally jumped to her feet, holding up the remote as some sort of defense. Someone was definitely in the tower with her, on the same floor. It couldn’t be Happy since today was his day off, and Pepper was away on a business deal for her father. Y/N was supposed to be completely and utterly alone, but it didn’t seem like that was the case.

“Alright, whoever the hell thinks they can screw with me needs to grow a pair of balls and show themselves,” Y/N finally snapped, trying to appear intimidating despite the shakiness in her voice.

“So,” a voice cruelly stopped her from moving any further, turning towards the right where she found the culprit, leaning on the wall, twirling a delicate blade between his fingers. “Really thought those assholes would catch on with the fake lead. Guess I figured Stark would be smart enough to smell the bullshit.” He was extremely tall, his body build very thick, though out of muscle rather than fat. Adorned in all black, Y/N could see he was wearing what almost looked to be sort of an army uniform, though it wasn’t remotely camouflage.

“Wh-What?” Y/N whimpered.

“They call me Agerico, which in another context means powerful sword. I’ll let you take a guess on what I’m good at,” he stated, suddenly stepping away from the wall and slowly advancing to her.

“JARVIS, call my dad and tell them to get back here now!” Y/N shouted, finally leaping away, chucking the remote in Agerico’s way as some sort of defense, trying to make her way to the elevator.

“Wrong answer,” the man snarled, finally taking his dagger by the hilt and skillfully chucking it at her, easily subduing her since it landed perfectly into her shoulder. Taken by surprise, she fell to the ground painfully, growling in pain, but trying to get up quickly after. She couldn’t let this happen. She wouldn’t let this happen.

“Not so fast, Miss Stark,” Agerico sneered, digging his boot into her back to keep her down as he leaned down and protruded the dagger painfully from her newly made wound, ignoring her painful yell as a result. “You know, I never thought I’d take up a position of like some sort of shit villain. Never really dug the tights and suits, but any dumbass knows how loaded Stark is. All I had to do was build a name for myself…leave a few bodies behind…leave a fake lead, and I have access to not only the entire tower, but his daughter, too.”

“Go to hell,” Y/N grunted.

“Screw you,” he bit back, taking his boot off and leaning down to throw her to her back instead, holding her down with the threat by digging the knife slightly into her throat, not stabbing or slicing just yet, only to put another state of fear within her, so she wouldn’t try anything else. Sadly, he was underestimating who she exactly was.

“JARVIS, summon my summer project!” Y/N called with struggle. Agerico looked confused, only to cry out in pain a moment later as something hit his head, momentarily confusing him, but it gave Y/N the chance to seize it and throw up her knee quite horrifically painfully into his crotch, giving her the chance to get to her feet and point toward him. Once he got to his feet, he could see she was wearing what looked to be a wrist gauntlet, black in color with a tiny knob at the top that was pointed towards him.

“What the hell is that supposed to be?” he asked, once again twirling his blade, this time more maliciously with its precision.

“Something I designed after meeting a good friend in Wakanda,” Y/N hissed, before clenching her fist and releasing the blue energy from the knob, hitting him square in the chest and onto his back. Shuri had helped her design it when Y/N decided her summer would be spent with her, aiding the small Stark with new inventions. “Now, here’s what’s going to happen…you’re going to toss me that knife, you’re gonna get up and face the wall like a good little boy, and you’re gonna wait for my father to return and kick your ass all over again before putting you behind bars. If not, I have no problem switching the gauntlet into overdrive.”

“My mama always did tell me that if I go out, I go out fighting,” Agerico snarled, throwing the knife again, catching her by surprise as it landed cleverly into her stomach, driving her back. But, thanks to her newfound adrenaline, she could barely feel it, taking the hilt and throwing the knife aside, smirking as she raised her wrist again. “Let’s dance, then, you son of a bitch…”

With that, she clenched her fist again and twirled it counterclockwise, instead of throwing him back, the blue energy almost attracting him magnetically, sending himself straight into her raised fist and sending him onto his back, his nose crooked and bleeding. Once more, she clenched her fist and, this time, twisted it clockwise and the blue energy surrounded him like an uncoiled snake, keeping him in place. Just as she backed away to see her new imprisoned criminal, the elevator doors swung open and suddenly the entire team was running out from its depths, all panicky and terrified, but they paused upon seeing Y/N standing above a bound man with her fist held out to keep him in place with her weapon.

“Y/N,” Tony breathed out a sigh of relief, his mask popping off so he could see her easier. “What…Y/N, you’re…you’re bleeding!”

Peter appeared from the crowd, though he couldn’t remove his mask with the culprit right there, so instead he dashed forward to throw his arms around his girlfriend, only to pause on seeing her bloody shoulder and stomach.

“You stabbed my daughter?” Tony snarled angrily, turning to Agerico, his blasters quickly heating up. “You thought you’d get away with that?” He opened his palm as he pointed it to him, put a hand on his chest stopped him. Looking down, he saw it was Y/N, smiling at him calmly.

“I’m fine. I got him alright…just call Fury and have him send his men over to take him. Nat, contact authorities and tell them Agerico is finally caught. Bruce, I’ll need your help, but I think I can stitch myself up okay.” Y/N was eerily calm, finally unclenching her fist, allowing the blue energy binds to fall from Agerico’s petrified form.

“But…you…he…” Steve sputtered, at a loss for words.

“When the hell did you suddenly become a badass superhero?” Peter asked in awe, his cheeks distinctly red and his mouth dropped from both amazement and attraction, though he still kept eyeing her injuries with disdain.

“It’s in my blood. Now let’s hurry before I bleed out and die because I feel awesome right now and I think that would really suck.”

Imagine taking down a villain all on your own

Summary: The heroes leave Y/N alone at the Tower when they get a lead on a dangerous villain, but what they don’t know is said villain was hiding out in the Tower. Now he is with Y/N and will do whatever it takes to end her life and get what he needs. What he doesn’t know is Y/N isn’t going to let that happen.

Pairing(s): Tony Stark x Stark!Reader, Peter Parker x Reader

“Are you sure you have to go?” Y/N asked wantonly, her arms hung lazily over his shoulders. He chuckled fondly, turning on the spot to place his hands carefully at her waist. He was wearing half his suit, keeping his mask off for the time being until the team would leave for the mission they were initially called to after a lead on a powerful villain arose, giving them a chance to hit him head on and stop his ways. “I’m sure Dad and the others will be just fine.”

“Has to be the whole team. I really want Mr. Stark to know I’m committed to the team as much as I can be.” Peter insisted, before leaning forward to peck her lips. “I’ll be back right after and we can watch a movie or something, okay?” Y/N pouted, but nodded anyway. She knew it was wrong for her to pull him from something he loved. He definitely loved the Avengers to the moon and back. It was his dream to be a part of them.

“You gonna be okay, baby girl?” Tony’s voice interrupted her train of thought, making her turn to face her father, who was covered by his suit but left his head free. “I left my card on the counter if you want something to eat. We’ll be back as soon as we can.” Smiling, he kissed her forehead before waving towards the others. “Let’s go!”

Each of the heroes made way to follow their unofficial leader, bidding Y/N goodbyes with either side hugs, kisses, or a high-five in Scott’s case. Soon enough, it was dead silent on the floor, leaving her all alone while her family would go to save the world. It became a pattern of being alone and being surrounded by so many people who she loved so much. Y/N got used to it, although it didn’t stop the small bouts of panic she carried that one of them would get hurt. It always seemed to be either her father or Peter catching the wrong end of that stick.

“Guess it’s marathon time,” Y/N mumbled to herself shuffling her way to the large living area equipped for everyone, as well as an armchair for Thor since he tended to fling his arms around whenever he got excited at what was on; that resulted in countless bruises for an unfortunate Steve, who always somehow got to sit next to him.

Sitting down at her usual spot, she retrieved the remote and switched it on, already trailing through channels as she hummed quietly to herself.

Then she suddenly stopped.

Her eyebrows fiddling together in order to give her a distinctly confused expression, she muted the screen and got up to her knees, turning on the spot to look over the couch. She was sure she heard footsteps. They were far too heavy to be mistaken as an animal. But now it was too quiet to tell if she was assuming things or not.

As cliché as it was, she couldn’t help but call out, “Hello?”

Silence.

Deciding her mind was playing tricks on her, Y/N gave herself a little shake before she returned to her previous position, grabbing at the remote.

BANG!

Y/N finally jumped to her feet, holding up the remote as some sort of defense. Someone was definitely in the tower with her, on the same floor. It couldn’t be Happy since today was his day off, and Pepper was away on a business deal for her father. Y/N was supposed to be completely and utterly alone, but it didn’t seem like that was the case.

“Alright, whoever the hell thinks they can screw with me needs to grow a pair of balls and show themselves,” Y/N finally snapped, trying to appear intimidating despite the shakiness in her voice.

“So,” a voice cruelly stopped her from moving any further, turning towards the right where she found the culprit, leaning on the wall, twirling a delicate blade between his fingers. “Really thought those assholes would catch on with the fake lead. Guess I figured Stark would be smart enough to smell the bullshit.” He was extremely tall, his body build very thick, though out of muscle rather than fat. Adorned in all black, Y/N could see he was wearing what almost looked to be sort of an army uniform, though it wasn’t remotely camouflage.

“Wh-What?” Y/N whimpered.

“They call me Agerico, which in another context means powerful sword. I’ll let you take a guess on what I’m good at,” he stated, suddenly stepping away from the wall and slowly advancing to her.

“JARVIS, call my dad and tell them to get back here now!” Y/N shouted, finally leaping away, chucking the remote in Agerico’s way as some sort of defense, trying to make her way to the elevator.

“Wrong answer,” the man snarled, finally taking his dagger by the hilt and skillfully chucking it at her, easily subduing her since it landed perfectly into her shoulder. Taken by surprise, she fell to the ground painfully, growling in pain, but trying to get up quickly after. She couldn’t let this happen. She wouldn’t let this happen.

“Not so fast, Miss Stark,” Agerico sneered, digging his boot into her back to keep her down as he leaned down and protruded the dagger painfully from her newly made wound, ignoring her painful yell as a result. “You know, I never thought I’d take up a position of like some sort of shit villain. Never really dug the tights and suits, but any dumbass knows how loaded Stark is. All I had to do was build a name for myself…leave a few bodies behind…leave a fake lead, and I have access to not only the entire tower, but his daughter, too.”

“Go to hell,” Y/N grunted.

“Screw you,” he bit back, taking his boot off and leaning down to throw her to her back instead, holding her down with the threat by digging the knife slightly into her throat, not stabbing or slicing just yet, only to put another state of fear within her, so she wouldn’t try anything else. Sadly, he was underestimating who she exactly was.

“JARVIS, summon my summer project!” Y/N called with struggle. Agerico looked confused, only to cry out in pain a moment later as something hit his head, momentarily confusing him, but it gave Y/N the chance to seize it and throw up her knee quite horrifically painfully into his crotch, giving her the chance to get to her feet and point toward him. Once he got to his feet, he could see she was wearing what looked to be a wrist gauntlet, black in color with a tiny knob at the top that was pointed towards him.

“What the hell is that supposed to be?” he asked, once again twirling his blade, this time more maliciously with its precision.

“Something I designed after meeting a good friend in Wakanda,” Y/N hissed, before clenching her fist and releasing the blue energy from the knob, hitting him square in the chest and onto his back. Shuri had helped her design it when Y/N decided her summer would be spent with her, aiding the small Stark with new inventions. “Now, here’s what’s going to happen…you’re going to toss me that knife, you’re gonna get up and face the wall like a good little boy, and you’re gonna wait for my father to return and kick your ass all over again before putting you behind bars. If not, I have no problem switching the gauntlet into overdrive.”

“My mama always did tell me that if I go out, I go out fighting,” Agerico snarled, throwing the knife again, catching her by surprise as it landed cleverly into her stomach, driving her back. But, thanks to her newfound adrenaline, she could barely feel it, taking the hilt and throwing the knife aside, smirking as she raised her wrist again. “Let’s dance, then, you son of a bitch…”

With that, she clenched her fist again and twirled it counterclockwise, instead of throwing him back, the blue energy almost attracting him magnetically, sending himself straight into her raised fist and sending him onto his back, his nose crooked and bleeding. Once more, she clenched her fist and, this time, twisted it clockwise and the blue energy surrounded him like an uncoiled snake, keeping him in place. Just as she backed away to see her new imprisoned criminal, the elevator doors swung open and suddenly the entire team was running out from its depths, all panicky and terrified, but they paused upon seeing Y/N standing above a bound man with her fist held out to keep him in place with her weapon.

“Y/N,” Tony breathed out a sigh of relief, his mask popping off so he could see her easier. “What…Y/N, you’re…you’re bleeding!”

Peter appeared from the crowd, though he couldn’t remove his mask with the culprit right there, so instead he dashed forward to throw his arms around his girlfriend, only to pause on seeing her bloody shoulder and stomach.

“You stabbed my daughter?” Tony snarled angrily, turning to Agerico, his blasters quickly heating up. “You thought you’d get away with that?” He opened his palm as he pointed it to him, put a hand on his chest stopped him. Looking down, he saw it was Y/N, smiling at him calmly.

“I’m fine. I got him alright…just call Fury and have him send his men over to take him. Nat, contact authorities and tell them Agerico is finally caught. Bruce, I’ll need your help, but I think I can stitch myself up okay.” Y/N was eerily calm, finally unclenching her fist, allowing the blue energy binds to fall from Agerico’s petrified form.

“But…you…he…” Steve sputtered, at a loss for words.

“When the hell did you suddenly become a badass superhero?” Peter asked in awe, his cheeks distinctly red and his mouth dropped from both amazement and attraction, though he still kept eyeing her injuries with disdain.

“It’s in my blood. Now let’s hurry before I bleed out and die because I feel awesome right now and I think that would really suck.”

title: The Public Menace of Queens
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2oyIAgs

by pollutedstar

Peter Parker is just trying to make a living as any teen would, selling good pictures of Spider-man to The Daily Bugle and watching Vine compilations, when the Sokovia Accords are signed. Now he has to grapple with the fact that the way he’s been upholding the law is illegal, and how much he desperately wants to keep his identity a secret while also helping his city. He’s on his own, with no superheroes to save him but himself, while having to lie to everyone he cares about. When he makes the crucial decision between his city and its law, he draws attention from both the government and unexpected help.

title: Avengers: Protect the Nerd!
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PXVHo4

by Anonymous

Be aware: I’m terrible at summaries!

Basically, Tony is a nerdy rich boy in a suburb where its cool to be rich but not nerdy. He gets bullied, but not for being a nerd.

Steve finds him one day, after he had been beat up. Its then that Steve decides to protect Tony however he can.

Multiple chapters, switching POV. Updates may take a while, I’m a senior in HS so I’m pretty busy.

The first chapter is kinda short I think? I don’t know, you can decide for yourself. I’d love to hear what you think in the comments!
